title: Release of Epstein files set to fuel further conspiracy theories | ABC NEWS
description: Following months of speculation, Donald Trump has ordered the release of documents relating to Jeffrey Epstein. The US President has been under pressure from his party and the MAGA base to provide transparency over the files. Anthropologist Alexander Hinton discusses how MAGA would react to the release and warns it could fuel new conspiracy theories. title: Airlines ban use of portable power banks onboard | ABC NEWS
description: Virgin Australia passengers will have to keep power banks within sight and easily accessible throughout flights from December 1. Qantas, QantasLink and Jetstar will introduce similar measures from December 15. It follows several recent international cases where lithium batteries have caught fire.  By national tourism reporter Kristy Sexton-McGrath.  Social version by Tatenda Chibika and Catherine Clare for the ABC News Social Media Team. title: Republican Marjorie Taylor Greene to resign after fallout with Trump | ABC NEWS
description: Marjorie Taylor Greene, a prominent Republican, has resigned from Congress after a dispute with President Trump, who called her a 'traitor' for criticising his stance on the 'Epstein files.' Greene believes Republicans will likely lose the upcoming midterm elections, with her last day in office on January 5. title: Volunteers plead for respect on frontline as bushfire season begins | ABC NEWS
description: Country Fire Service (CFS) volunteers in South Australia's Riverland say they are experiencing roadside abuse while responding to incidents.  The organisation's headquarters says the offence carries "severe" penalties.  As bushfire season gets underway, regional CFS captains are asking for a media blitz to help recruit more volunteers and stamp out abuse. title: Tropical Cyclone Fina to track between Darwin and Tiwi Islands | ABC NEWS
description: Tropical Cyclone Fina is approaching Darwin as a Category 3 system. Residents are advised to activate their emergency plans. It is expected to track over the waters between Darwin and the Tiwi Islands, with residents urged to prepare for gale-force winds, flash flooding, and dangerous tides. title: Donald Trump showers praise on Zohran Mamdani | ABC NEWS
description: Donald Trump has showered praise on New York's mayor-elect, Zohran Mamdani, during a warm and friendly press conference where they pledged to work together to lower living costs in America's biggest city. The US president and the democratic socialist had spent months trading pointed barbs, but presented a united front after meeting at the White House, even as reporters asked about their past attacks on each other. "We just had a great meeting. I think you're going to have, hopefully, a really great mayor. He has views that are a little out there, but who knows? I think he is going to surprise some conservative people, actually." Mr Trump said.  Video by John Lyons. Social version by David Douglas Stuart for the ABC News Social Media Team.  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: Will house prices hit new highs in 2026? | ABC NEWS
description: House prices are expected to reach record highs in all capital cities by the end of next year, according to Domain's forecast report for 2026.   Domain's report reveals the biggest increase in house prices will be seen in the most rate-sensitive cities of Sydney and Melbourne.   Nicola Powell says Sydney's median house price is expected to hit $1.9 million in 2026, and setting a pathway for a $2 million median house price in Sydney by 2027.   #ABCBusiness  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Australian doctors visit PNG conjoined twins to assess options | ABC NEWS
description: The ABC has exclusive access to film a rare set of conjoined twins born in remote Papua New Guinea six weeks ago. A team of Sydney doctors is in Port Moresby to assess the twins, despite initial reluctance from a local hospital to refer them for overseas treatment. The Sydney Children's Hospital team arrived on Thursday to evaluate the possibility of separation, but a medical transfer is not guaranteed. title: Long-awaited trade deal with the EU on the line for Australia at the G20 | ABC NEWS
description: The G20 Summit has kicked off in South Africa with leaders of the world's top economies coming together for an event overshadowed by a boycott by Donald Trump. Anthony Albanese has talked up the importance of Australia participating in global forums, using the opportunity to progress talks with the European Union on a long-awaited trade deal. National Affairs correspondent Jane Norman reports from Johannesburg. title: Severe Tropical Cyclone Fina intensifies as it crosses near Darwin | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 The destructive core of Category Three Tropical Cyclone Fina is set to pass just north of Darwin in the late hours of Saturday night. Warnings for hurricane force winds are currently in place as well as for flash flooding and dangerously high tides. Fina is expected to track over waters between the Tiwi Islands and Darwin around 9pm before strengthening to a category four system as it heads towards Western Australia. Hundreds of people have sought safety in cyclone shelters while thousands of others hunker down at home and wait for the worst to pass. 02:57 ABC Meteorologist Nate Byrne 06:10 An update from Emergency services 07:49 An update from NT Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro 10:07 Prime Minister Anthony Albanese   Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-11-22/tropical-cyclone-fina-live-blog-saturday-november-22/106038950 https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-11-22/severe-tropical-cyclone-fina-saturday-category-three-darwin/106040320  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad.
